column2: Anna, Kate and Lisa went on holiday together. Use the information about them to complete the sentences.
column3: They stayed at a hotel. Everybody liked it, even {{c1::Kate}}.

column2: Anna, Kate and Lisa went on holiday together. Use the information about them to complete the sentences.
column3: They arranged to meet. They all arrived on time, even {{c1::Lisa}}.

column2: Anna, Kate and Lisa went on holiday together. Use the information about them to complete the sentences.
column3: They went to an art gallery. Nobody enjoyed it, not even {{c1::Amy}}.

column2: Anna, Kate and Lisa went on holiday together. Use the information about them to complete the sentences.
column3: Yesterday they had to get up early. They all managed to do this, even {{c1::Lisa}}.

column2: Anna, Kate and Lisa went on holiday together. Use the information about them to complete the sentences.
column3: They were together yesterday. They were all in a good mood, even {{c1::Kate}}.

column2: Anna, Kate and Lisa went on holiday together. Use the information about them to complete the sentences.
column3: None of them took any pictures, not even {{c1::Lisa}}.
